page.title: 05A SMALL FARM IN COCKFIELD 2
page.content: The cultivations of the crops are as follows:for the wheat Mr.Lilley ploughs rolls,springtime or duckfoot harrows and drills;then he light harrows and rolls:for the barley he ploughs then duckfoot harrows twice;then he drills and lightly harrows and finally rolls: for the sugar beet,he ploughs then duckfoot harrows;after that he has to dutch harrow then drill;if necessary he will hoe the beet.When the crops have been harvested,the wheat goes to a grain merchant for feed wheat and then it goes for animal feed.The barley goes to a grain merchant for malting barley and is used for malt.Lastly,the sugar beet goes by lorry to the Bury Sugar Beet Factory to be made into sugar.I am Zoe,Mr.Lilley's daughter. The manager of the sugar beet factory is Mr.Davenport.Abigail is in this class:she is his daughter.
